metadata.dc:author: Castro-Bouzas, D
Gelabert-González, M

Prieto-González, A
Santín-Amo, J M
Arcos-Algaba, A
Arias-Gómez, M
metadata.dc:description: Hypoglossal nerve palsy is commonly associated with the involvement of other cranial nerves. His injury is rarely isolated. We present a patient in which paralysis is due to the presence of a "juxtafacet cyst" of the atlanto-occipital joint. We review the anatomy of the hypoglossal nerve, different therapeutic options, the differential diagnosis and papers published to date.
metadata.dc:title: Parálisis aislada del nervio hipogloso secundaria a quiste articular atlanto-occipital. Presentación de un caso y revisión de la literatura.
[Isolated hypoglossal nerve palsy secondary to an atlantoccipital joint synovial cyst. Case report and literature review].
